Sir 'WILFRID LAURIER. I have given my opinion for what it is worth and I have said that although I have been 9: lawyer it was many, many years ago and I do not pretend to give a legal opinion. I have given my opinion for what it is worth and if my hon. friend reads the Act, not section 137 alone, but the whole con- text, I think you will ﬁnd there is a pre- vious section which gives the power to have separate schools and that power is given to Protestants and Catholics.
